intro: Pimpinella panul, commonly known as the Mexican cowpea or Mexican thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into dry, three-lobed fruits containing several seeds. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
